Package uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon.owl

Root package for the MEKON-OWL plug-ins, which contains a collection of MEKON-friendly wrapper classes for the OWL API, which are used by the plug-ins, as well as providing the general MEKON-OWL overview documentation.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    OAxiomPurgeSpec
    Specification of an axiom-purge operation.
    OModelConfigVocab
    Vocabulary used in the OModel-definition section of the MEKON configuration file.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    OEntities<E extends org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLEntity>
    Represents set of OWLEntity objects of a specific type.
    OLogger
    Logger that prints out timing information for the OWL ontology and reasoner loading operations.
    OModel
    Provides access to an OWL model and associated reasoner, via methods for accessing the relevant OWL API objects, plus a set of MEKON-specific convenience methods.
    OModelBuilder
    Responsible for creating an OModel object representing a set of ontologies loaded from disk, together with an associated reasoner.
    OModelCopier
    Responsible for copying the model represented by an OModel object, possibly with a different type of reasoner and/or updated reasoning-type.
    OModelCreator
    Responsible for creating an OModel object representing either a set of ontologies loaded directly from disk, or the contents of an existing model.
    OMonitor
    Monitor for loading of the OWL ontology and loading of the reasoner.
    ThreadSafeOWLReasoner  
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    OReasoningType
    Specifies the type of reasoning that a matcher is required to perform.

Package uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon.owl Description

Root package for the MEKON-OWL plug-ins, which contains a collection of MEKON-friendly wrapper classes for the OWL API, which are used by the plug-ins, as well as providing the general MEKON-OWL overview documentation.

MEKON-OWL Overview

MEKON-OWL consists of a set of OWL-specific plug-ins for MEKON (and hence for HOBO). These plug-ins enable the following:

  • MEKON/HOBO models to be derived from OWL ontologies
  • Automatic model-instantiation updating via Description Logic (DL) reasoning
  • Querying over sets of instances, via OWL-compatible reasoning (DL-based and otherwise)

All of these plug-ins are built on top of the OWL API.

The plug-ins are:

  • Model-Section Builder: OBSectionBuilder is an implementation of CSectionBuilder which builds an indirect section of the frames model (FM) based on a set of OWL ontologies loaded via a standard "sanctioning" mechanism.
  • Instance Reasoner: ORClassifier is an implementation of IReasoner based on a DL reasoner operating over a set of OWL ontologies, using either OWL class-expressions or ad-hoc networks of OWL individuals to represent the instances.
  • Instance Matcher: ORMatcher is an abstract implementation of uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon.store.motor.IMatcher based on a DL reasoner operating over a set of OWL ontologies, with specific extension classes that use OWL class-expressions and ad-hoc networks of OWL individuals to represent the instances.

These plug-ins are compatible with each other, and can be used either together or seperately, possibly in conjunction with other compatible section-building and reasoning plug-ins.

All plug-ins are configurable in various ways, either programatically, via methods on the relevant classes, or else via the general MEKON configuration system.

OBSectionBuilder can be configured to determine which collections of entities will be loaded from the relevant ontologies, and exactly how they will be used in creating the MEKON FM entities.

Both ORClassifier and ORMatcher can be configured to determine how the FM instantiations will be interpreted semantically when composing the OWL expressions and networks of OWL individuals to be classified and queried over. In both cases, it is possible to provide pre-processors to reshape intermediate node/link network versions of the FM instantiations, prior to conversion into OWL constructs (see uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon.network).

All plug-ins make use of the OModel class, which provides MEKON-friendly access of OWL ontologies and DL reasoners via the OWL API. Similarly to the plug-ins themselves, the OModel can be configured either programatically or else via the general MEKON configuration system.

For a general overview of MEKON-OWL, the MEKON framework, and other related software see mekon-hobo project website.
